program main

   implicit none

   integer :: n, a, b, c, res1, res2, temp, n_digits, i, current_digit, bills

   integer, dimension(0:20) :: digits

   integer, parameter :: maxn =4010

   integer, dimension(0:maxn-1) :: dp

   character(len=20) :: str2, result_char

   ! First part: read input and compute res1

   read*, n, a, b, c

   dp = -huge(0)

   dp(0) =0

   integer :: arr(3) = [a, b, c]

   do i=1,3

      integer :: coin = arr(i)

      do j=coin, maxn-1

         if (dp(j - coin) +1 > dp(j) ) then

             dp(j) = dp(j - coin) +1

         end if

      end do

   end do

   res1 = dp(n)

   ! Second part: compute res2 from res1

   temp = res1

   n_digits =0

   digits =0

   do while (temp >0)

      digits(n_digits) = mod(temp,10)

      temp = temp /10

      n_digits =n_digits +1

   end do

   bills =0

   do i=0, n_digits

      if (digits(i) ==10) then

         digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) +1

         digits(i) =0

      end if

      current_digit = digits(i) if (current_digit <5) then

         bills = bills + current_digit

      else if (current_digit ==5) then

         if (digits(i+1) >=5) then

            digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) +1

         end if

         bills = bills +5

      else

         digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) +1

         bills = bills + (10 - current_digit)

      end if

   end do

   res2 = bills

   ! Third part: compute final character

   write(str2, '(i0)') res2

   str2 = adjustl(str2) if (len_trim(str2) ==0) then

      str2 = '0'

   end if

   result_char = char(ichar(str2(1:1))

Now, let's write the Fortran code.

But first, note that in Fortran, arrays are 1-based by default, so we need to declare arrays with 0-based indices.

Also, the first part's dp array needs to be 0-based.

Now, the full code:

program main

   implicit none

   integer :: n, a, b, c, res1, res2, temp, n_digits, i, current_digit, bills

   integer, dimension(0:20) :: digits

   integer, parameter :: maxn =4010

   integer, dimension(0:maxn-1) :: dp

   character(len=20) :: str2, result_char

   ! First part: read input and compute res1

   read*, n, a, b, c

   dp = -huge(0)

   dp(0) =0

   integer :: arr(3) = [a, b, c]

   do i=1,3

      integer :: coin = arr(i)

      do j=coin, maxn-1

         if (dp(j - coin) +1 > dp(j) ) then

             dp(j) = dp(j - coin) +1

         end if

      end do

   end do

   res1 = dp(n)

   ! Second part: compute res2 from res1

   temp = res1

   n_digits =0

   digits =0

   do while (temp >0)

      digits(n_digits) = mod(temp,10)

      temp = temp /10

      n_digits =n_digits +1

   end do

   bills =0

   do i=0, n_digits

      if (digits(i) ==10) then

         digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) +1

         digits(i) =0

      end if

      current_digit = digits(i)

      if (current_digit <5) then

         bills = bills + current_digit

      else if (current_digit ==5) then

         if (digits(i+1) >=5) then

            digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) +1

         end if

         bills = bills +5

      else

         digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) +1

         bills = bills + (10 - current_digit)

      end if

   end do

   res2 = bills

   ! Third part: compute final character

   write(str2, '(i0)') res2

   str2 = adjustl(str2)

   if (len_trim(str2) ==0) then

      str2 = '0'

   end if

   result_char = char(ichar(str2(1:1)) +1)

   print '(A)', trim(result_char)

end program main
